channel.title: [ADVANCED] City Invasion
channel.description:
So basically all I've done is made a handler for the 'invasion.' It's attached to this post. It loads the invasionspawn configuration file which contains the NPCs that will invade. It currently has chickens (for testing :P). Now, in a nutshell what this is:
A method which loads NPC's from a CFG. This will be used for a city invasion once a player completes an objective.
I've loaded the method with a command, or, ::invasion.
The problem is: You can continually LOAD those monsters. What I need is a method of [i]removing[/i] the spawned NPCs. That's where I need help. If any of you have a method that removes an NPC/NPCS then can you please post it? I'll add a timer after I get both working.
Halp ~ Not Pwnd

item.title: [ADVANCED] City Invasion
item.dc:creator: @Not_Pwnd Not Pwnd
item.description:
@Not_Pwnd wrote:

I know for the loading of the InvasionSpawn I used the Autospawn code, and I never cleaned it up.

@ jarnohhh. I didn’t include the invasion spawn :P… This is just the handler for the method…

But again: Can an expert please write me a remove-npc method?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 02, 2008, 05:50:59 PM[/size][hr]

item.title: [ADVANCED] City Invasion
item.dc:creator: @Not_Pwnd Not Pwnd
item.description:
@Not_Pwnd wrote:

So basically all I’ve done is made a handler for the ‘invasion.’ It’s attached to this post. It loads the invasionspawn configuration file which contains the NPCs that will invade. It currently has chickens (for testing :P). Now, in a nutshell what this is:

A method which loads NPC’s from a CFG. This will be used for a city invasion once a player completes an objective.

I’ve loaded the method with a command, or, ::invasion.

The problem is: You can continually LOAD those monsters. What I need is a method of removing the spawned NPCs. That’s where I need help. If any of you have a method that removes an NPC/NPCS then can you please post it? I’ll add a timer after I get both working.

Halp ~ Not Pwnd
